t: Ezekiel 29
Proclamation Against Egypt
In*p the tenth year, in the tenth month,*i on the twelfth day*i of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all Egypt.

Speak, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*pn I am*i against you, O*ld Pharaoh king of Egypt, O*ld great monster who lies in the midst of his rivers, Who*ld has said, ‘My River is*i my own; I*ld have made it*i for myself.’

But*ld I will put hooks in your jaws, And*ld cause the fish of your rivers to stick to your scales; I*ld will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, And*ld all the fish in your rivers will stick to your scales.

I*ld will leave you in the wilderness, You*ld and all the fish of your rivers; You*ld shall fall on the open field; You*ld shall not be picked up or gathered. I*ld have given you as food To*ld the beasts of the field And*ld to the birds of the heavens.
“Then*ln all the inhabitants of Egypt Shall*ld know that I am*i the Lord,*s Because*ld they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
When*ld they took hold of you with the hand, You*ld broke and tore all their shoulders; When*ld they leaned on you, You*ld broke and made all their backs quiver.”
‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Surely I will bring a sword upon you and cut off from you man and beast.
And the land of Egypt shall become desolate and waste; then they will know that I am*i the Lord,*s because he said, ‘The River is*i mine, and I have made it.’*i
Indeed, therefore, I am*i against you and against your rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, from Migdol to*i Syene, as far as the border of Ethiopia.
Neither foot of man shall pass through it nor foot of beast pass through it, and it shall be uninhabited forty years.

I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that*i are*i desolate; and among the cities that*i are*i laid waste, her cities shall be desolate forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.”
‘Yet,*p thus says the Lord God:*s “At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered.
I will bring back the captives of Egypt and cause them to return to the land of Pathros, to the land of their origin, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
It shall be the lowliest of kingdoms; it shall never again exalt itself above the nations, for I will diminish them so that they will not rule over the nations anymore.
No longer shall it be the confidence of the house of Israel, but will remind them of their*i iniquity when they turned to follow them. Then they shall know that I am*i the Lord God.”’”*s
Babylonia Will Plunder Egypt
And*p it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month,*i on the first day*i of the month, that*i the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,

“Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre; every head was*i made bald, and every shoulder rubbed raw; yet neither he nor his army received wages from Tyre, for the labor which they expended on it.

Therefore thus says the Lord God:*s ‘Surely I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; he shall take away her wealth, carry off her spoil, and remove her pillage; and that will be the wages for his army.
I have given him the land of Egypt for*i his labor, because they worked for Me,’ says the Lord God.*s
‘In*p that day I will cause the horn of the house of Israel to spring forth, and I will open your mouth to speak in their midst. Then they shall know that I am*i the Lord.’”*s
